title: Chancellor announces November 6 Budget
text:
Sajid Javid will hold his first post-Brexit Budget on November 6, provided Boris Johnson can deliver a new deal with the European Union.

The Chancellor yesterday announced the plans ahead of the Queen’s Speech. He said he will use his first Budget to “shape the economy and deliver our infrastructure revolution”.

The Office for Budget Responsibility, the independent economic forecaster, has been told to provide economic forecasts on the basis that the UK can agree a new deal and leave on Oct 31.

However if Britain leaves the EU without a deal on October 31, the Treasury said it would outline its approach and “take early action to support the economy, businesses and households”.
